units.title: Organoid generation in 96‑well plates
units.text: organoids were generated in 96-well plates, where pluripotent stem cells (H9 and HES3 lines; the latter modified to report the expression of the retinal progenitor marker NKX2-1) were aggregated into embryoid bodies and cultured in minimal neural induction media (MNIM) to induce neuroectodermal fates (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Describes the initial step of creating neural organoids from stem cells.

units.title: Control condition without morphogen
units.text: In each batch, one condition did not receive any morphogen pathway modulator, but was exposed to the same base media and, therefore, served as control.
units.rationale: Specifies the baseline condition against which treatments are compared.

units.title: Application of concentration gradients
units.text: We applied concentration gradients in microfluidic chips or increasing static concentrations in multi-well plates and observed different patterning dynamics in each scenario.
units.rationale: Outlines two delivery methods for morphogen gradients.

units.title: Morphogen addition schedule
units.text: Morphogen treatments were added at early and intermediate time points (days 0–3, 10–13 and 14–17) using CHIR99021 (CHIR, WNT pathway activator), XAV939 (WNT pathway inhibitor), rh‑SHH/CS24II (SHH), purmorphamine, FGF‑8B (FGF8), RA, rh‑BMP‑4 (BMP4) and rh‑BMP‑7 (BMP7).
units.rationale: Provides the timing and list of morphogens used for patterning.

units.title: Single‑cell preparation and hashing
units.text: Organoids were dissociated into single‑cell suspensions, followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single‑cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics).
units.rationale: Details the workflow for multiplexed single‑cell RNA‑seq.

units.title: In situ HCR validation
units.text: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) stainings confirmed the presence of more retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations.
units.rationale: Describes a validation assay for regional marker expression.

units.title: Quantifying cell‑type diversity
units.text: We measured the heterogeneity of each patterning condition using the Shannon diversity index, where lower scores indicate lower cell‑type diversity.
units.rationale: Explains the metric used to assess compositional heterogeneity.

units.title: Assessing morphogen interaction non‑linearity
units.text: We calculated cluster enrichment/depletion scores for each morphogen treatment and used non‑negative least squares (NNLS) residuals to assess non‑linearity of morphogen combinations.
units.rationale: Provides the analytical approach to detect synergistic or antagonistic effects.
